shows.title: Economic Forecast / Police Paranormal Encounters
shows.guests: Harry S. Dent, Marianne Robb, Dave Rich
shows.first_half: Financial advisor Harry S. Dent Jr. shared his outlook on the U.S. and global economies. Followed by retired police officers Marianne Robb and Dave Rich on law enforcement encounters with unexplained phenomena.

shows.title: Ancient Mystics / UFOs & Aliens
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and lecturer Ken Hanson will discuss the mysterious ancient mystics known by some as the Visionaries and by others as the Enochians. Long before UFO stories, ancient Israelites were telling tales of beings who came down from the sky, taught forbidden knowledge, and nearly destroyed the world.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Filmmaker and casting director Craig Campobasso will delve into UFOs and aliens, including reports of 82 distinct races of ETs. He'll also share intriguing findings from his latest book, The UFO Hotspot Compendium, including the best places to see a UFO.

shows.title: Space Program & ETs / Wildlife Conservation
shows.guests: Brooks Agnew, Cheryll Jones, David McChesney
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and multi-patented engineer Brooks Agnew will talk about the current state of the space program, the latest in UFO disclosure, and the alien presence on planet Earth.
shows.second_half: Second Half: C2C's investigative reporter Cheryll Jones presents her interview with photographer, author, and conservationist David McChesney, known for his captivating wildlife photography used to help save and protect select species and environmental areas. In the last hour, McChesney will take live calls with Cheryll and George.

shows.title: Hauntings & Folklore / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Folklorist, historian, and paranormal researcher Rissa Miller will share how a childhood ghost sighting set her on a lifelong path of uncovering hidden stories. She believes that history, folklore, and the supernatural are not separate realms, but overlapping forces that echo and inform one another. Drawing on years of research and fieldwork, she'll discuss her investigations into haunted houses and cemeteries, as well as her exploration of urban legends, cryptids, and the enduring traditions of witchcraft and magic. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give George a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
